articles.author: Tapas Adhikary
articles.description:
What is Abstraction?


Abstraction is an Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) principle that means hiding internal details(or complexities) and exposing only essential parts to the end users. Think of it like using a TV remote ‚Äî you press a button to switch channels, but you don‚Äôt need to understand the circuitry behind it.
In code, abstraction helps keep things clean, maintainable, and secure. Users interact with simple methods, while complex logic stays away.
Abstraction is one of the four pillars of OOP, along with Encapsulation, Inheritance, and Polymorphism. It helps with:
Simplicity: It hides unnecessary complexity.
Security: Sensitive logic or data can be kept private.
Maintainability: Internal changes don‚Äôt affect users of the class.
Reusability: You can reuse the same interface acros‚Ä¶
articles.title: Abstraction in JavaScript: Washing Machine Style!"

articles.author: Deepak Kumar
articles.description:
1. Introduction


The first time I stumbled upon MongoDB‚Äôs aggregation framework, I was in the middle of building a client dashboard for a freelancing project. The client wanted insights‚Äîtotal revenue by category, monthly user activity, and top contributors. I thought simple .find() queries with some frontend filtering would do the job. I was wrong.
Pagination was slow, filtering was clunky, and combining multiple collections felt like reinventing SQL joins in JavaScript. That‚Äôs when I realized the real power of MongoDB wasn‚Äôt just in storing JSON-like data‚Äîit was in how you transform that data. And aggregation pipelines became my go-to tool.
If you‚Äôre building admin panels, dashboards, analytics reports, or even gamified leaderboards like I‚Äôve done with TheCampusCoders challenges, aggrega‚Ä¶
articles.title: Mastering MongoDB Aggregation for Real Projects: From Basics to Real-World Powerhouse

articles.author: Bytes&Vibes
articles.description:
Most developers use AI like a simple search engine. They ask basic questions and get basic answers. But I discovered 5 different prompting strategies that actually leverage AI's reasoning capabilities.
These aren't just variations of "fix my code" - they're fundamentally different approaches that solve different problems.
You are a senior developer with 10 years of experience in [technology]. 
I'm working on [brief project description].

[Your specific question/request]

Consider performance, maintainability, and best practices in your response.

Why it works: AI performs dramatically better when given a specific role and project context. It's the difference between getting generic advice vs. expert guidance.
Show me 3 different approaches to solve this problem:
1. The quick and simple sol‚Ä¶
articles.title: 5 Prompts That Cut My Development Time in Half

articles.description:
If you've ever found yourself copy-pasting LinkedIn profile or trying to piece together someone's work history for a resume, you know how tedious (and time-consuming) it can be. Let me introduce you to the LinkedIn Profile Extract and JSON Resume Builder ‚Äî An n8n-powered automation that does all the heavy lifting for you.
With the help of Bright Data for reliable LinkedIn scraping and Google Gemini for intelligent data extraction and formatting, this workflow turns raw profile data into a polished, standards-compliant JSON Resume ready to be used in HR tools, recruiting platforms, or even personal websites.
Whether you're building a talent p‚Ä¶
articles.title: How I automated the LinkedIn Profile Extract and JSON Resume Building with Bright Data & Google Gemini

Today, we‚Äôre excited to share a big milestone: all Langfuse product features are now open source under the MIT license.
The LLM landscape is evolving rapidly - and so are the tools and workflows that developers use to build and improve their LLM applications. To empower our community and invite deeper collaboration, we‚Äôve decided to open source all previously commercial features of Langfuse.
That means you can now self-host features like:
Managed LLM-as-a-Judge evaluations


Annotation queues


Prompt experiments

LLM playground
All fully open under the MIT license.

If you're already self-hosting Langfuse, upgrade to the latest version to unlock these new features.
Why we‚Äôre doing this


Langfuse is building the open source LLM engineering platform - a platform to observe, evaluate, and i‚Ä¶
articles.title: All Langfuse Product Features now Free Open-Source

articles.author: Geri M√°t√©
articles.description:
Deploying AI agents in production is trickier than most teams expect. What works perfectly in development often becomes a reliability nightmare once real traffic hits.
After looking at incident reports, some clear patterns emerge. The same few issues keep causing the majority of production failures.
42% of AI agent failures come from hallucinated API calls, and another 23% are GPU memory leaks. These aren't edge cases - they're systematic problems that need systematic solutions.
Here's what's actually breaking and how to prevent it.
LLMs generate code that looks correct but calls non-existent methods or deprecated endpoints. Traditional validation tools miss this because the code is syntactically valid - it just references APIs that don't exist in your environment.
Teams often spend signif‚Ä¶
articles.title: How to Prevent AI Agents From Breaking in Production

articles.author: Elena Hartmann
articles.description:
Need to translate a document and keep the formatting / layout in place for your company or organization? You‚Äôre not alone. One of the most tedious tasks involved in enterprise translation production is file formatting.
In order to translate a document or PDF and keep formatting, layout, images, etc. (a good portion of it), the language translation software you are using must encode the file. These files need to be in a deliverable format matching the original source file. However, many translation tools don‚Äôt have the functionality in place to save you hours of time on re-formatting your translated document.
Consequently, you get displaced images, lost font properties and wacky paragraph breaks ‚Äî or a lack thereof. This becomes especially problematic when you‚Äôre tasked with translating doc‚Ä¶
articles.title: How to Translate Document & Keep the Formatting

articles.author: Juan F Gonzalez
articles.description:
Can you remember when you first started here on DEV?

I can even though it's been quite long.
I remember the first post I did, circa August 2018, was after I finished a short coding Bootcamp that I got into thanks to a friend.
It's the first time I made a post of technical nature online in English (my second language).
I still cringe a little reading it... But it was a stepping stone into technical writing (which I'd later find out it's quite difficult). 
I only started wanting to write for real in January of 2020. Made 2 posts that month, couldn't keep up with a regular posting schedule and then you know what happened that year...
With the extra time from being locked down at my home, I resumed the writing at the end of June and then kept going on posting (mostly) weekly for the rest of that year (and then the year afterwards).
It's been quite a wild ride with all its ups and downs. 
And maybe it's time to come back here to post my learnings and experiences about my new undertaking in the World's Largest Hackathon of Bolt(dot)new.
articles.title: 7 is the perfect number

articles.author: Carrie
articles.description:
If you're unable to automatically install SafeLine via the following command:
bash -c "$(curl -fsSLk https://waf.chaitin.com/release/latest/manager.sh)" -- --en

Please refer to this guide.
Install the latest version of Docker.
If you already have Docker installed, please skip this step.
curl -sSL "https://get.docker.com/" | bash

Create a directory for SafeLine to use, SafeLine will write its configuration and data to this directory. (You need to have at least 5GB of disk space)
mkdir -p "/data/safeline"

Download the latest docker compose script by using the following command.
cd "/data/safeline"
wget "https://waf.chaitin.com/release/latest/compose.yaml"

‚ÄºÔ∏èImportant:
https://github.com/chaitin/SafeLine/blob/main/compose.yaml
cd "/data/safeline"
touch ".env"

Write the following content ‚Ä¶
articles.title: How to Manually Install SafeLine WAF
